items.title: Russian general killed in bomb attack in a suspected Ukraine intelligence services operation
items.standfirst: A Russian general ⁠was killed by a car bomb in southern Moscow on Monday, Russian investigators said, adding that they suspected Ukrainian special services could have been behind the attack.
items.content: A Russian general ⁠was killed by a car bomb in southern Moscow on Monday, Russian investigators said, adding that they suspected Ukrainian special services could have been behind the attack.

items.title: Russia investigates car bomb death of general – Europe live
items.standfirst: Official says investigators are pursuing ‘numerous lines’ in inquiry, including whether Ukrainian intelligence were involvedThe Guardian’s Russian affairs reporter, Pjotr Sauer, has some more detail on this developing story. Here is an extract from his report:Lt Gen Fanil Sarvarov, who oversees combat training and readiness for Russia’s armed forces in the war in Ukraine, has extensive experience in the Kremlin’s post-Soviet wars. He took part in both Chechen wars and later played a role in organising Russia’s 2015–16 military intervention in Syria.The Kremlin is expected to comment later on the attack, but some Russian officials have already called for retribution. Continue reading...
items.content: Official says investigators are pursuing ‘numerous lines’ in inquiry, including whether Ukrainian intelligence were involvedThe Guardian’s Russian affairs reporter, Pjotr Sauer, has some more detail on this developing story. Here is an extract from his report:Lt Gen Fanil Sarvarov, who oversees combat training and readiness for Russia’s armed forces in the war in Ukraine, has extensive experience in the Kremlin’s post-Soviet wars. He took part in both Chechen wars and later played a role in organising Russia’s 2015–16 military intervention in Syria.The Kremlin is expected to comment later on the attack, but some Russian officials have already called for retribution. Continue reading...

items.title: Russian general killed by car bomb in Moscow, say investigators
items.standfirst: Russia’s Investigative Committee says it is looking into whether Ukraine intelligence services were behind attackA Russian general has been killed after an explosive device detonated beneath his car in what Moscow described as a likely assassination carried out by Ukrainian intelligence services.Lt Gen Fanil Sarvarov, the head of the operational training directorate of the Russian armed forces’ general staff, died of his injuries, a spokesperson for Russia’s Investigative Committee said in a statement. Continue reading...
items.content: Russia’s Investigative Committee says it is looking into whether Ukraine intelligence services were behind attackA Russian general has been killed after an explosive device detonated beneath his car in what Moscow described as a likely assassination carried out by Ukrainian intelligence services.Lt Gen Fanil Sarvarov, the head of the operational training directorate of the Russian armed forces’ general staff, died of his injuries, a spokesperson for Russia’s Investigative Committee said in a statement. Continue reading...

items.title: Live: Russian general dies in Moscow car bomb attack
items.standfirst: A senior Russian general was killed Monday morning after an explosive device detonated underneath his car in southern Moscow, according to investigators. The possibility that the attack on Lt. Gen. Fanil Sarvarov, who led the Operational Training Directorate of the Russian Armed Forces General Staff, was "linked" to "Ukrainian special forces" was among their lines of inquiry, the investigators’ statement said. Follow our liveblog for all the latest.
items.content: A senior Russian general was killed Monday morning after an explosive device detonated underneath his car in southern Moscow, according to investigators. The possibility that the attack on Lt. Gen. Fanil Sarvarov, who led the Operational Training Directorate of the Russian Armed Forces General Staff, was "linked" to "Ukrainian special forces" was among their lines of inquiry, the investigators’ statement said. Follow our liveblog for all the latest.

items.title: Why is the US pursuing a third oil tanker off Venezuela in to weeks?
items.standfirst: The US intercepted ​an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela over the weekend, and was pursuing another one in what would be the third such operation in less than two weeks. What exactly is happening and why? Answer by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor Douglas Herbert.

items.title: US Coast Guard pursuing another oil tanker off coast of Venezuela
items.standfirst: Official indicates vessel is subject to sanctions after Trump’s ‘blockade’ on sanctioned tankers in and out of VenezuelaUS Coast Guard officials said on Sunday they were tracking an oil tanker in international waters close to Venezuela, multiple unnamed US officials have told US media, marking the second such action over the weekend – and the third within the past week.What officials described as an “active pursuit” in the Caribbean Sea took place a day after the coast guard seized another vessel off the coast of Venezuela, as Washington ramps up its pressure campaign targeting the South American nation’s vital oil sector. Continue reading...
items.content: Official indicates vessel is subject to sanctions after Trump’s ‘blockade’ on sanctioned tankers in and out of VenezuelaUS Coast Guard officials said on Sunday they were tracking an oil tanker in international waters close to Venezuela, multiple unnamed US officials have told US media, marking the second such action over the weekend – and the third within the past week.What officials described as an “active pursuit” in the Caribbean Sea took place a day after the coast guard seized another vessel off the coast of Venezuela, as Washington ramps up its pressure campaign targeting the South American nation’s vital oil sector. Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. pursuing third oil tanker off Venezuela coast, official says
items.standfirst: The U.S. Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker near Venezuela, a U.S. official tells CBS News. It's another move by the Trump administration to put pressure on Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro. Willie James Inman reports.
items.content: The U.S. Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker near Venezuela, a U.S. official tells CBS News. It's another move by the Trump administration to put pressure on Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro. Willie James Inman reports.

items.title: US intercepts second merchant vessel off coast of Venezuela in international waters
items.standfirst: Vessel does not appear to be on list of US-sanctioned vessels, which would represent escalation in blockadeUS forces on Saturday apprehended a second merchant vessel carrying oil off the coast of Venezuela in international waters in the midst of an American blockade against the country’s oil, according to the US homeland security department.The stoppage follows the seizure by US forces of another oil tanker off Venezuela’s coast on 10 December. Both vessels were headed to Asia. Continue reading...

Both vessels were headed to Asia. Continue reading...

items.title: Justice Department pulls down some Epstein files, says more could come down
items.standfirst: At least 15 documents related to Jeffrey Epstein that were initially made public have been pulled from the Justice Department website. The agency says it will keep reviewing and redacting materials to "protect victims." Shanelle Kaul has more.
items.content: At least 15 documents related to Jeffrey Epstein that were initially made public have been pulled from the Justice Department website. The agency says it will keep reviewing and redacting materials to "protect victims." Shanelle Kaul has more.

items.title: US Justice Department denies Epstein cover-up, restores photo of Trump to public files
items.standfirst: The US Justice Department said on Sunday it had restored an image of President Donald Trump that it had removed a day earlier from the public release of Epstein-related files. The photograph was reposted as lawmakers accused officials of withholding key information in files related to the late sex offender, including photos of Trump and other elites.
items.content: The US Justice Department said on Sunday it had restored an image of President Donald Trump that it had removed a day earlier from the public release of Epstein-related files. The photograph was reposted as lawmakers accused officials of withholding key information in files related to the late sex offender, including photos of Trump and other elites.

items.title: Nigeria says 130 abducted schoolchildren freed after mass kidnapping
items.standfirst: Nigerian authorities said Sunday they have secured the release of 130 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic boarding school in Niger state, bringing the total freed to more than 200 after a mass kidnapping in November. The announcement follows weeks of uncertainty over the fate of students taken by gunmen and renewed concern over Nigeria’s worsening kidnap-for-ransom crisis.
items.content: Nigerian authorities said Sunday they have secured the release of 130 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic boarding school in Niger state, bringing the total freed to more than 200 after a mass kidnapping in November. The announcement follows weeks of uncertainty over the fate of students taken by gunmen and renewed concern over Nigeria’s worsening kidnap-for-ransom crisis.

items.title: Another 130 kidnapped schoolchildren released in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Presidential spokesperson says all those abducted from a Catholic school in Niger state last month are now freeNigerian authorities say they have secured the release of a further 130 schoolchildren kidnapped from a Catholic school in November, after 100 were freed earlier this month.“Another 130 abducted Niger state pupils released, none left in captivity,” presidential spokesperson Sunday Dare said on X, in a post accompanied by a photo of smiling children. Continue reading...

items.title: Ukrainian and European officials had ‘productive’ talks on ending war, US envoy says
items.standfirst: Steve Witkoff says representatives share goals to stop killing, support Ukraine and end war with RussiaA White House envoy said on Sunday he held “productive and constructive” talks in Florida with Ukrainian and European representatives to end the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine.Posting on social media, Steve Witkoff said the talks aimed at aligning on a shared strategic approach between Ukraine, the US and Europe. Continue reading...
items.content: Steve Witkoff says representatives share goals to stop killing, support Ukraine and end war with RussiaA White House envoy said on Sunday he held “productive and constructive” talks in Florida with Ukrainian and European representatives to end the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine.Posting on social media, Steve Witkoff said the talks aimed at aligning on a shared strategic approach between Ukraine, the US and Europe. Continue reading...

items.title: US envoy Witkoff calls Ukraine talks in Miami 'productive'
items.standfirst: US special envoy Steve Witkoff called weekend talks in Florida “productive and constructive” as officials from the US, Europe, and Ukraine worked to align positions. President Donald Trump pushes for a quick end to the nearly four-year conflict, but Russia wants to keep seized Ukrainian land.

items.content: The talks to end the war in Ukraine shifted back to the U.S. this weekend, with Russian President Vladimir Putin’s envoy calling discussions “constructive” as Washington pushes for a peace deal by Christmas.

items.title: Gold prices hit record high on US interest rate-cut bets
items.standfirst: Gold hit a new record high on Monday, driven by expectations of US interest rate cuts and strong demand for safe-haven assets, while silver also reached an all-time peak. The gains mark a remarkable year for precious metals, supported by a weaker dollar, geopolitical tensions and strong investment inflows.
items.content: Gold hit a new record high on Monday, driven by expectations of US interest rate cuts and strong demand for safe-haven assets, while silver also reached an all-time peak. The gains mark a remarkable year for precious metals, supported by a weaker dollar, geopolitical tensions and strong investment inflows.

items.standfirst: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.
items.content: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

items.title: Israel approves 19 new Jewish settlements in occupied West Bank
items.standfirst: Israel has approved 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank in a fresh blow to the possibility of a Palestinian state.
items.content: Israel has approved 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank in a fresh blow to the possibility of a Palestinian state.

items.title: Israel approves 19 new West Bank settlements
items.standfirst: Israel has approved 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank, bringing the three-year total to 69. The move comes despite UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres's recent condemnation of what he called the "relentless" expansion of settlements in the occupied territory.
items.content: Israel has approved 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank, bringing the three-year total to 69. The move comes despite UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres's recent condemnation of what he called the "relentless" expansion of settlements in the occupied territory.

items.title: Israel approves 19 new Jewish settlements in occupied West Bank
items.standfirst: Decision takes the total number of new settlements to 69 in past few years as construction binge continuesIsrael has approved a proposal for 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank as the government pushes ahead with a construction binge in the territory that poses a further threat to the possibility of a Palestinian state.It brings the total number of new settlements over the past few years to 69, a new record, according to the far-right finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, who has pushed a settlement expansion agenda in the West Bank. The latest include two that were previously evacuated during a 2005 disengagement plan. Continue reading...
items.content: Decision takes the total number of new settlements to 69 in past few years as construction binge continuesIsrael has approved a proposal for 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank as the government pushes ahead with a construction binge in the territory that poses a further threat to the possibility of a Palestinian state.It brings the total number of new settlements over the past few years to 69, a new record, according to the far-right finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, who has pushed a settlement expansion agenda in the West Bank. The latest include two that were previously evacuated during a 2005 disengagement plan. Continue reading...

items.title: Denmark to summon US ambassador over Trump Greenland envoy appointment
items.standfirst: Danish foreign minister ‘deeply angered’ by move to send special envoy to territory Trump has threatened to annexDenmark has said it will summon the US ambassador after Donald Trump announced he had appointed a special envoy to Greenland, the Danish autonomous territory he has threatened to annex.“I am deeply angered by the appointment and the statement, which I find totally unacceptable,” the Danish foreign minister, Lars Løkke Rasmussen, told Denmark’s TV2 in an interview, adding that the foreign ministry would call in the US ambassador in the coming days “to get an explanation”. Continue reading...
items.content: Danish foreign minister ‘deeply angered’ by move to send special envoy to territory Trump has threatened to annexDenmark has said it will summon the US ambassador after Donald Trump announced he had appointed a special envoy to Greenland, the Danish autonomous territory he has threatened to annex.“I am deeply angered by the appointment and the statement, which I find totally unacceptable,” the Danish foreign minister, Lars Løkke Rasmussen, told Denmark’s TV2 in an interview, adding that the foreign ministry would call in the US ambassador in the coming days “to get an explanation”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Bondi beach attack: New revelations show massacre could have been even deadlier
clusters.neutral_headline: Bondi beach attack: New revelations show massacre could have been even deadlier

items.title: Bondi beach attack: New revelations show massacre could have been even deadlier
items.standfirst: Australia is reckoning with its deadliest mass shooting in decades after a father and son opened fire on crowds gathered for a Jewish festival at Bondi Beach. Newly released police allegations, witness testimony, and official statements show that the two suspects threw homemade pipe and tennis ball bombs at ⁠the crowd before the mass shooting but failed to detonate. Story by Ellen Gainsford.
items.content: Australia is reckoning with its deadliest mass shooting in decades after a father and son opened fire on crowds gathered for a Jewish festival at Bondi Beach. Newly released police allegations, witness testimony, and official statements show that the two suspects threw homemade pipe and tennis ball bombs at ⁠the crowd before the mass shooting but failed to detonate. Story by Ellen Gainsford.

items.title: Bondi gunmen threw homemade bombs before shooting and conducted training, police say
items.standfirst: The father and son accused of killing 15 people at a Hanukkah celebration threw four homemade explosive devices at the Bondi beach crowd before their mass shooting, investigators alleged in court documents released Monday
items.content: The father and son accused of killing 15 people at a Hanukkah celebration threw four homemade explosive devices at the Bondi beach crowd before their mass shooting, investigators alleged in court documents released Monday

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting suspect trained with father before attack, police say
items.standfirst: A man suspected of killing 15 people during a shooting in Bondi Beach "conducted firearms training" with his father before the attack on a Jewish event, Australian police have said.
items.content: A man suspected of killing 15 people during a shooting in Bondi Beach "conducted firearms training" with his father before the attack on a Jewish event, Australian police have said.

clusters.title: Bourbon maker Jim Beam stops production at Kentucky site for 2026
clusters.neutral_headline: Bourbon maker Jim Beam stops production at Kentucky site for 2026

items.title: Bourbon maker Jim Beam stops production at Kentucky site for 2026
items.standfirst: Whiskey brand, owned by Japanese drinks group Suntory, to close main distillery amid tariff uncertaintyThe maker of Jim Beam bourbon whiskey will halt production at its main site in Kentucky for all of 2026.The company said in a statement it would close its distillery in Clermont until it took the “opportunity to invest in site enhancements”. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Spain’s socialists shed voters in regional election as far right makes gains
clusters.neutral_headline: Spain’s socialists shed voters in regional election as far right makes gains

items.title: Spain’s socialists shed voters in regional election as far right makes gains
items.standfirst: Vox doubles its seats in Extremadura as Socialist Workers’ party, mired in corruption scandals, loses 10 of its 28 seats Spain’s ruling Socialist Workers’ party (PSOE), already reeling from a series of corruption and sexual harassment scandals, has suffered another blow with a disastrous showing in Sunday’s regional election in the north-western region of Extremadura.The PSOE lost 10 of its 28 seats as the far-right Vox party doubled its representation on two years ago from five to 11 seats. Continue reading...
items.content: Vox doubles its seats in Extremadura as Socialist Workers’ party, mired in corruption scandals, loses 10 of its 28 seats Spain’s ruling Socialist Workers’ party (PSOE), already reeling from a series of corruption and sexual harassment scandals, has suffered another blow with a disastrous showing in Sunday’s regional election in the north-western region of Extremadura.The PSOE lost 10 of its 28 seats as the far-right Vox party doubled its representation on two years ago from five to 11 seats. Continue reading...

items.title: Spain's ruling Socialists suffer historic defeat in regional election
items.standfirst: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez’s embattled Socialists suffered a heavy defeat in Sunday’s regional election in Extremadura, slumping to their worst-ever result as the far-right Vox made strong gains, dealing another blow to the party amid mounting corruption and misconduct allegations.
items.content: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez’s embattled Socialists suffered a heavy defeat in Sunday’s regional election in Extremadura, slumping to their worst-ever result as the far-right Vox made strong gains, dealing another blow to the party amid mounting corruption and misconduct allegations.

items.content: During the outage, California residents reported spotting Waymo vehicles stalled on the streets, disrupting traffic and causing a gridlock. Read more: Waymo resumes San Francisco service after blackout causes suspension

items.title: Waymos Froze, Blocked Traffic During San Francisco Power Outage
items.standfirst: Waymo’s driverless ride services were a high-profile victim of a power outage that affected large swaths of San Francisco, with cars freezing mid-ride across the city and disrupting traffic.
items.content: Waymo’s driverless ride services were a high-profile victim of a power outage that affected large swaths of San Francisco, with cars freezing mid-ride across the city and disrupting traffic.

items.title: REPLAY: Africa Cup of Nations build-up special
items.standfirst: The African Cup of Nations opens in Rabat tonight with a match between the host country, Morocco and the Comoros. Ahead of kick-off, FRANCE 24's Emily Boyle was in the studio with special guests to talk all things AFCON.

clusters.title: Gunmen kill nine in South Africa tavern attack
clusters.neutral_headline: Gunmen kill nine in South Africa tavern attack

items.title: Gunmen kill nine in South Africa tavern attack
items.standfirst: A further 10 people were injured in Bekkersdal after the perpetrators opened fire and "continued to shoot randomly".
items.content: A further 10 people were injured in Bekkersdal after the perpetrators opened fire and "continued to shoot randomly".

items.title: Gunmen kill nine in Johannesburg township in South Africa’s second mass shooting this month
items.standfirst: Attackers wound 10 others in Bekkersdal after opening fire at people in a bar and ‘randomly’ shooting in the street, police sayNine people have been killed after gunmen opened fire at a bar near Johannesburg in the second mass shooting in South Africa this month.Ten more were wounded in the early morning attack at the tavern in the impoverished Bekkersdal township in a gold mining area about 25 miles (40km) south-west of Johannesburg. Continue reading...
items.content: Attackers wound 10 others in Bekkersdal after opening fire at people in a bar and ‘randomly’ shooting in the street, police sayNine people have been killed after gunmen opened fire at a bar near Johannesburg in the second mass shooting in South Africa this month.Ten more were wounded in the early morning attack at the tavern in the impoverished Bekkersdal township in a gold mining area about 25 miles (40km) south-west of Johannesburg. Continue reading...
